body.p: Changes a role name or membership.

section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock:
ALTER GROUP groupname ADD USER username [, ... ]
ALTER GROUP groupname DROP USER username [, ... ]
ALTER GROUP groupname RENAME TO newname

section.title: Description
section.p: ALTER GROUP changes the attributes of a user group. This is an obsolete command, though still accepted for backwards compatibility, because users and groups are superseded by the more general concept of roles. See for more information.

The first two variants add users to a group or remove them from a group. Any role can play the part of groupname or username. The preferred method for accomplishing these tasks is to use GRANT and REVOKE.

plentry.pd: The name of the group (role) to modify.
Users (roles) that are to be added to or removed from the group. The users (roles) must already exist.
The new name of the group (role).

section.title: Examples
section.p: To add users to a group:
section.codeblock: ALTER GROUP staff ADD USER karl, john;
section.p: To remove a user from a group:
section.codeblock: ALTER GROUP workers DROP USER beth;

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: There is no ALTER GROUP statement in the SQL standard.
